title: Liverpool reject loan bid from Southampton for defender Mamadou Sakho
text:
However, Liverpool are looking for a permanent sale and are believed to be asking for around £20million for the star. 
Crystal Palace, Sevilla and Swansea have also made enquiries with Kop chiefs about Sakho’s availability. related articles Los in translation £615,000 a week Carlos Tevez is mobbed as he arrives in China - after it emerges Chinese government blocked a potential world record £104m transfer for star name not going to pay Arsene Wenger rules out Dimitri Payet bid and confirms Carl Jenkinson is on verge of leaving Arsenal Transfers live All the latest breaking news and gossip from the January transfer window KEANE ON A MOVE Robbie Keane admits he is in line for a Championship move but NOT to former clubs Leeds or Wolves 
He has not played a minute for Liverpool this season after falling foul of Klopp during the club’s pre-season tour to America. 
Sakho is desperate to move, but the saga looks set to continue right up until deadline day. 
Fonte has been left out of the Southampton side since handing in a transfer request. PA:Press Association Southampton have been rejected in their attempt to bring Sakho in on loan Getty Images
